column4: did you show us your /etc/apt/sources.list and all files in /etc/apt/sources.list.d  ?  if not please use a pastebin :)
looks normal to my eyes, did you try with sudo aptitude safe-upgrade? that often solves those pesky "partial-upgrade" problems
then I don't know either - sorry (although I seem to remember some sort of database corruption within the apt-database...)
... database curromtpion? hummm it might be (dunno why)
such things happen, but I honestly don't know how to deal with such a beast (I don't expect the janitor to help..)
as far as I remember there is, but I don't know the procedure
and di you try with aptitude too? I now remember once solving a similar problem by using apt-get instead of aptitude (or the other way round)
sad - I was just fishing for ideas
i cann always format and put ubuntu 11.04 fresh :)
